text:
Family of man who died in Awakino Gorge crash watched it happen JEREMY WILKINSON Last updated 13:21, February 20 2017 SUPPLIED 
Haji Abu Bakar Ramil died in a crash in Awakino on Sunday afternoon while his wife Kamimah Sepet followed in the car behind him. 
The daughter and wife of a man who died in a crash in North Taranaki on Sunday were following right behind him when he crashed. 
Haji Abu Bakar Ramli, 56, died at the scene after his car collided with another vehicle at a bend in the Awakino Gorge at 1.30pm, while the driver of the other car remains in a stable condition in Taranaki Base Hospital. 
Ramli's daughter Nurghaklisaa Aquila Abu Bakar said the family was moving to Auckland and her father was driving with most of their possessions while she and her mother followed closely behind. Supplied 
Haji Abu Bakar Ramil had lived with his family in New Plymouth for eight years, after travelling over from Malaysia. 
"The whole thing happened slowly ... like slow motion. I saw him skid, then the other car came from around the bend and they hit each other, then he [her father] hit a bank," she said. 
READ MORE: 
"We stopped on the side of the road and ran over to him to try get him out. KIRSTY MCMURRAY/Stuff.co.nz 
: The scene of a car crash near Awakino. One person has died and another two have been taken to hospital seriously injured. 
"We were calling his name but we knew he was not there anymore." 
Abu Bakar said there were several doctors and nurses in the cars behind them who ran to their aid, but there was nothing they could do for Ramli. 
"I just don't understand how it happened, I don't know what he skidded on or why that happened," she said. Kirsty McMurray 
Traffic was backed up for kilometres after the accident early on Sunday afternoon. 
"He was driving so slow, he was always a slow driver - he hated to speed." Ad Feedback 
For now, the family won't know exactly what caused the crash - other than what they saw - until the Serious Crash Unit has completed their investigation. 
The family's plans to move out of New Plymouth - where they've lived for eight years since moving from Malaysia - have been put on hold while they organise a funeral and get their head around the tragedy. Kirsty McMurray 
Police, fire and ambulance staff blocked the road off for several hours, 
Abu Bakar said she couldn't put into words what her father meant to her, only that he was "a very, very kind man". 
"He was known for his kind heart, it was what people in the community recognised him for." 
Following the crash, traffic was backed up for four hours while police blocked the road off to investigate the scene, opening it again by the evening. Waikato Westpac Rescue Helicopter 
The Waikato Westpac Rescue Helicopter was at the scene and transported one man to Taranaki Base Hospital. 
The Waikato Westpac Rescue Helicopter was sent to scene and the driver of the other vehicle involved - a 62-year-old man from New Plymouth - was taken to Taranaki Base Hospital with serious chest and abdominal injuries, but is now in a stable condition. 
The crash occurred roughly five kilometres north of the Awakino Tunnel in the Awakino Gorge - a windy stretch of State Highway that connects Taranaki and the Waikato. 
Ramli's funeral will be held at the New Plymouth Islamic Centre on Smart Rd on Monday or Tuesday evening. - Stuff
